required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating a 13-Valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine in Healthy Infants
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Active-Controlled, Double-blind Trial Evaluating the Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity of a 13-valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine in Healthy Infants Given With a Meningococcal C-Tetanus Toxoid Conjugate Vaccine and Other Routine Pediatric Vaccinations in Spain

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety, tolerability and immunogenicity of a 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate (13vPnC) vaccine compared to Prevenar (7vPnC), when given concomitantly with routine paediatric vaccinations in Spain.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Serum Bactericidal Assay (SBA) Titer ≥ 1:8 in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 2-dose NeisVac-C Infant Series
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after infant series dose (at 5 months of age)
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving a meningococcal C SBA serum antibody titer greater than or equal to (≥) 1:8 along with the corresponding 95% confidence interval (CI) are presented.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titers (GMT) for Meningococcal C Antibodies in as Measured by Serum Bactericidal Assay (SBA) 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 2-dose NeisVac-C Infant Series and the Toddler Dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after infant series dose 2 (at 5 months of age) and one month after toddler dose (at 16 months of age)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Predefined Antibody Levels for Diphtheria and Tetanus in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 3-dose Infant Series and After the Toddler Dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after infant series dose 3 (at 7 months of age) and one month after the toddler dose (at 16 months of age)
primary_outcome.description: Predefined antibody levels for Diphtheria (0.01 or 0.1 International units [IU]/mL) and Tetanus (0.01 or 0.1 [IU]/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentrations (GMC) for Diphtheria and Tetanus in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 3-dose Infant Series and After the Toddler Dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after infant series dose 3 (at 7 months of age) and one month after the toddler dose (at 16 months of age)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Antibody Level ≥ 0.35μg/mL in 13vPnC Group After the Second and the Third Dose of a 3-Dose Infant Series and After the Toddler Dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after infant series dose 2 (at 5 months of age) and dose 3 (at 7 months of age) and one month after the toddler dose (at 16 months of age)
primary_outcome.description: Percentages of participants achieving World Health Organization (WHO) predefined antibody threshold ≥ 0.35 μg/mL along with the corresponding 95% CI for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration (GMC) in 13vPnC Group After the Second and the Third Dose of a 3-Dose Infant Series and After the Toddler Dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after infant series dose 2 (at 5 months of age) and dose 3 (at 7 months of age) and one month after the toddler dose (at 16 months of age)
primary_outcome.description: GMC as measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented. GMCs (13vPnC) were calculated for each pneumococcal serotype and timepoint, and 2-sided, 95% CI were constructed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Serum Bactericidal Assay (SBA) Titer ≥ 1:8 in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the Toddler Dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One month after toddler dose (at 16 months of age)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving a meningococcal C SBA serum antibody titer ≥ 1:8 along with the corresponding 95% confidence interval (CI) are presented.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Local Reactions
other_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day period after each dose
other_outcome.description: Local reactions were collected using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (Sig)(present and interfered with limb movement). Swelling and redness were scaled as Any (swelling or redness present); Mild (0.5 centimeters [cm] to 2.0 cm); Moderate (Mod) (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (Sev) (>7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Systemic Events
other_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day period after each dose
other_outcome.description: Systemic events (fever [Fv] ≥ 37.5 degrees Celsius [C], fever ≥ 38 C but ≤ 39 C, fever >39 C but ≤ 40 C, fever > 40 C, decreased (Decr) appetite, irritability, increased (Incr) sleep, decreased sleep, hives, use of medication (Meds) to treat symptoms (Sx), and use of medication to prevent symptoms were reported using an electronic diary. Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.

intervention.description: 1 dose at 2,4,6 and 15 months of age
1 dose at 2,4,6 and 15 months of age

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy 2-month-old infants
- Available for the entire study period
Exclusion criteria:
- Previous vaccination with any vaccine before the start of the study
- Known contraindication to vaccination

overall_official.affiliation: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited in Spain from 4 July 2007 to 23 July 2007.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants were enrolled into the study according to the inclusion/exclusion criteria without a screening period.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and combined diphtheria-tetanus-acellular pertussis (DTPa), hepatitis B, inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b (Hib) vaccine (Infanrix hexa) at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series Dose 2) and one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at the 6-month visit (infant series dose 3). Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and combined DTPa, inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b (Hib) vaccine (Infanrix IPV + Hib) at the 15-month visit (toddler dose). Measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine (MMR) was administered without study vaccine at the 12-month visit.

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (7vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and combined diphtheria-tetanus-acellular pertussis (DTPa), hepatitis B, inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b (Hib) vaccine (Infanrix hexa) at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series Dose 2) and one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at the 6-month visit (infant series dose 3). Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and combined DTPa, inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b (Hib) vaccine (Infanrix IPV + Hib) at the 15-month visit (toddler dose). Measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine (MMR) was administered without study vaccine at the 12-month visit.

participants_list.participants: One participant was randomized to 7vPnC, but received 13vPnC.
One participant was randomized to 7vPnC, but received 13vPnC.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and combined diphtheria-tetanus-acellular pertussis (DTPa), hepatitis B, inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b (Hib) vaccine (Infanrix hexa) at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series Dose 2) and one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at the 6-month visit (infant series dose 3). Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and combined DTPa, inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b (Hib) vaccine (Infanrix IPV + Hib) at the 15-month visit (toddler dose). Measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine (MMR) was administered without study vaccine at the 12-month visit.

group.title: 7vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (7vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and combined diphtheria-tetanus-acellular pertussis (DTPa), hepatitis B, inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b (Hib) vaccine (Infanrix hexa) at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series Dose 2) and one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at the 6-month visit (infant series dose 3). Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and combined DTPa, inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b (Hib) vaccine (Infanrix IPV + Hib) at the 15-month visit (toddler dose). Measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine (MMR) was administered without study vaccine at the 12-month visit.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Serum Bactericidal Assay (SBA) Titer ≥ 1:8 in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 2-dose NeisVac-C Infant Series
outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving a meningococcal C SBA serum antibody titer greater than or equal to (≥) 1:8 along with the corresponding 95% confidence interval (CI) are presented.
outcome.time_frame: One month after infant series dose (at 5 months of age)
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population consisting of eligible participants who adhered to protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations; (n)= number of participants with a determinate immunoglobulin G (IgG) antibody concentration to the given concomitant vaccine component.

group.title: 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix hexa at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series Dose 2).

group.title: 7vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix hexa at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series Dose 2).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Serum Bactericidal Assay (SBA) Titer ≥ 1:8 in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 2-dose NeisVac-C Infant Series
measure.description: Percentage of participants achieving a meningococcal C SBA serum antibody titer greater than or equal to (≥) 1:8 along with the corresponding 95% confidence interval (CI) are presented.
measure.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population consisting of eligible participants who adhered to protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations; (n)= number of participants with a determinate immunoglobulin G (IgG) antibody concentration to the given concomitant vaccine component.

analysis.groups_desc: For Meningococcal C the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) at >=1:8 titer was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for immune response induced by NeisVac-C was declared if the lowest limit of 2-sided 95% CI for the difference between the 2 groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) greater than (>) -10%.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Local Reactions
outcome.description: Local reactions were collected using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (Sig)(present and interfered with limb movement). Swelling and redness were scaled as Any (swelling or redness present); Mild (0.5 centimeters [cm] to 2.0 cm); Moderate (Mod) (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (Sev) (>7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day period after each dose
outcome.population: The safety population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of vaccine, (n) = number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days.

group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix hexa at the 2-month visit.

group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix-IPV+Hib at the 15-month visit.

Swelling and redness were scaled as Any (swelling or redness present); Mild (0.5 centimeters [cm] to 2.0 cm); Moderate (Mod) (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (Sev) (>7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.

outcome.description: Systemic events (fever [Fv] ≥ 37.5 degrees Celsius [C], fever ≥ 38 C but ≤ 39 C, fever >39 C but ≤ 40 C, fever > 40 C, decreased (Decr) appetite, irritability, increased (Incr) sleep, decreased sleep, hives, use of medication (Meds) to treat symptoms (Sx), and use of medication to prevent symptoms were reported using an electronic diary. Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.

measure.description: Systemic events (fever [Fv] ≥ 37.5 degrees Celsius [C], fever ≥ 38 C but ≤ 39 C, fever >39 C but ≤ 40 C, fever > 40 C, decreased (Decr) appetite, irritability, increased (Incr) sleep, decreased sleep, hives, use of medication (Meds) to treat symptoms (Sx), and use of medication to prevent symptoms were reported using an electronic diary. outcome.title: Geometric Mean Titers (GMT) for Meningococcal C Antibodies in as Measured by Serum Bactericidal Assay (SBA) 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 2-dose NeisVac-C Infant Series and the Toddler Dose
outcome.time_frame: One month after infant series dose 2 (at 5 months of age) and one month after toddler dose (at 16 months of age)
outcome.population: The evaluable 2-dose immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

group.title: 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix hexa at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series Dose 2).

group.title: 7vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix hexa at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series Dose 2)

group.title: 13vPnC After Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix IPV + Hib at the 15-month visit (toddler dose). MMR was administered without study vaccine at the 12-month visit.

group.title: 7vPnC After Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix IPV + Hib at the 15-month visit (toddler dose). MMR was administered without study vaccine at the 12-month visit.

measure.title: Geometric Mean Titers (GMT) for Meningococcal C Antibodies in as Measured by Serum Bactericidal Assay (SBA) 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 2-dose NeisVac-C Infant Series and the Toddler Dose
measure.population: The evaluable 2-dose immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

analysis.groups_desc: For Meningococcal C the GMT ratio (13vPnC/7vPnC) was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for or immune response induced by NeisVac-C was declared if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI for the GMT ratio (13vPnC group/7vPnC group) was >0.5 (2-fold criterion).

analysis.groups_desc: For Meningococcal C the GMT ratio (13vPnC/7vPnC) was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for or immune response induced by NeisVac-C was declared if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI for the GMT ratio (13vPnC group/7vPnC group) was >0.5 (2-fold criterion).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Predefined Antibody Levels for Diphtheria and Tetanus in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 3-dose Infant Series and After the Toddler Dose
outcome.description: Predefined antibody levels for Diphtheria (0.01 or 0.1 International units [IU]/mL) and Tetanus (0.01 or 0.1 [IU]/mL).
outcome.time_frame: One month after infant series dose 3 (at 7 months of age) and one month after the toddler dose (at 16 months of age)
outcome.population: The evaluable 3-dose immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

group.title: 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at the 6-month visit (infant series dose 3).

group.title: 7vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at the 6-month visit (infant series dose 3).

group.title: 13vPnC After Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix IPV + Hib at the 15-month visit (toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC After Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix IPV + Hib at the 15-month visit (toddler dose).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Predefined Antibody Levels for Diphtheria and Tetanus in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 3-dose Infant Series and After the Toddler Dose
measure.description: Predefined antibody levels for Diphtheria (0.01 or 0.1 International units [IU]/mL) and Tetanus (0.01 or 0.1 [IU]/mL).
measure.population: The evaluable 3-dose immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

analysis.groups_desc: For diphtheria the difference in percentage between the two groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) at >=0.10 IU/mL threshold was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lowest limit of 2-sided 95% CI for the difference between the 2 groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) > -10%.

analysis.groups_desc: For diphtheria the difference in percentage between the two groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) at >=0.01 IU/mL threshold was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lowest limit of 2-sided 95% CI for the difference between the 2 groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) > -10%.

analysis.groups_desc: For tetanus the difference in percentage between the two groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) at >=0.10 IU/mL threshold was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lowest limit of 2-sided 95% CI for the difference between the 2 groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) > -10%.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lowest limit of 2-sided 95% CI for the difference between the 2 groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) > -10%.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lowest limit of 2-sided 95% CI for the difference between the 2 groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) > -10%.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lowest limit of 2-sided 95% CI for the difference between the 2 groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) > -10%.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentrations (GMC) for Diphtheria and Tetanus in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 3-dose Infant Series and After the Toddler Dose
outcome.time_frame: One month after infant series dose 3 (at 7 months of age) and one month after the toddler dose (at 16 months of age)
outcome.population: The evaluable 3-dose immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

group.title: 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at the 6-month visit (infant series dose 3).

group.title: 7vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at the 6-month visit (infant series dose 3).

group.title: 13vPnC After Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix IPV + Hib at the 15-month visit (toddler dose).

group.title: 7vPnC After Toddler Dose
group.description: SParticipants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix IPV + Hib at the 15-month visit (toddler dose).

measure.title: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentrations (GMC) for Diphtheria and Tetanus in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the 3-dose Infant Series and After the Toddler Dose
measure.population: The evaluable 3-dose immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

analysis.groups_desc: For diphtheria toxoid the GMC ratio (13vPnC/7vPnC) was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI for the GMC ratio (13vPnC group/7vPnC group) was >0.5 (2-fold criterion).

analysis.groups_desc: For tetanus the GMC ratio (13vPnC/7vPnC) was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI for the GMC ratio (13vPnC group/7vPnC group) was >0.5 (2-fold criterion).

analysis.groups_desc: For diphtheria toxoid the GMC ratio (13vPnC/7vPnC) was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI for the GMC ratio (13vPnC group/7vPnC group) was >0.5 (2-fold criterion).

analysis.groups_desc: For tetanus the GMC ratio (13vPnC/7vPnC) was calculated
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for concomitant antigens was declared if the lower bound of the 2-sided, 95% CI for the GMC ratio (13vPnC group/7vPnC group) was >0.5 (2-fold criterion).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Antibody Level ≥ 0.35μg/mL in 13vPnC Group After the Second and the Third Dose of a 3-Dose Infant Series and After the Toddler Dose
outcome.description: Percentages of participants achieving World Health Organization (WHO) predefined antibody threshold ≥ 0.35 μg/mL along with the corresponding 95% CI for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.
outcome.time_frame: One month after infant series dose 2 (at 5 months of age) and dose 3 (at 7 months of age) and one month after the toddler dose (at 16 months of age)
outcome.population: The evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

group.title: 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix hexa at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series Dose 2).

group.title: 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at the 6-month visit (infant series dose 3).

group.title: 13vPnC After Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix IPV + Hib at the 15-month visit (toddler dose).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Antibody Level ≥ 0.35μg/mL in 13vPnC Group After the Second and the Third Dose of a 3-Dose Infant Series and After the Toddler Dose
measure.description: Percentages of participants achieving World Health Organization (WHO) predefined antibody threshold ≥ 0.35 μg/mL along with the corresponding 95% CI for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.
measure.population: The evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration (GMC) in 13vPnC Group After the Second and the Third Dose of a 3-Dose Infant Series and After the Toddler Dose
outcome.description: GMC as measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented. GMCs (13vPnC) were calculated for each pneumococcal serotype and timepoint, and 2-sided, 95% CI were constructed.
outcome.time_frame: One month after infant series dose 2 (at 5 months of age) and dose 3 (at 7 months of age) and one month after the toddler dose (at 16 months of age)
outcome.population: The evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

group.title: 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix hexa at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series Dose 2).

group.title: 13vPnC After Infant Series Dose 3
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at the 6-month visit (infant series dose 3).

group.title: 13vPnC After Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix IPV + Hib at the 15-month visit (toddler dose).

measure.title: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration (GMC) in 13vPnC Group After the Second and the Third Dose of a 3-Dose Infant Series and After the Toddler Dose
measure.description: GMC as measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented. GMCs (13vPnC) were calculated for each pneumococcal serotype and timepoint, and 2-sided, 95% CI were constructed.
measure.population: The evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population was the primary analysis population consisting of eligible subjects who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Serum Bactericidal Assay (SBA) Titer ≥ 1:8 in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the Toddler Dose
outcome.description: Percentage of participants achieving a meningococcal C SBA serum antibody titer ≥ 1:8 along with the corresponding 95% confidence interval (CI) are presented.
outcome.time_frame: One month after toddler dose (at 16 months of age)
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population consisting of eligible participants who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations; (n)= number of participants with a determinate IgG antibody concentration to the given concomitant vaccine component.

group.title: 13vPnC After Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and combined diphtheria-tetanus-acellular pertussis (DTPa), hepatitis B, inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b (Hib) vaccine (Infanrix hexa) at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series Dose 2) and one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at the 6-month visit (infant series dose 3). Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and combined DTPa, inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b (Hib) vaccine (Infanrix IPV + Hib) at the 15-month visit (toddler dose). Measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine (MMR) was administered without study vaccine at the 12-month visit.

group.title: 7vPnC After Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (7vPnC) coadministered with meningococcal C-tetanus toxoid conjugate vaccine (NeisVac-C) and combined diphtheria-tetanus-acellular pertussis (DTPa), hepatitis B, inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b (Hib) vaccine (Infanrix hexa) at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series Dose 2) and one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at the 6-month visit (infant series dose 3). Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and combined DTPa, inactivated poliovirus, and hemophilus influenza type b (Hib) vaccine (Infanrix IPV + Hib) at the 15-month visit (toddler dose). Measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine (MMR) was administered without study vaccine at the 12-month visit.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Serum Bactericidal Assay (SBA) Titer ≥ 1:8 in 13vPnC Group Relative to 7vPnC Group After the Toddler Dose
measure.description: Percentage of participants achieving a meningococcal C SBA serum antibody titer ≥ 1:8 along with the corresponding 95% confidence interval (CI) are presented.
measure.population: Evaluable immunogenicity (per protocol) population consisting of eligible participants who adhered to the protocol requirements, had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations; (n)= number of participants with a determinate IgG antibody concentration to the given concomitant vaccine component.

analysis.groups_desc: For Meningococcal C the difference in percentages between the two groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) at ≥ 1:8 titer was calculated.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority for immune response induced by NeisVac-C was declared if the lowest limit of 2-sided 95% CI for the difference between the 2 groups (13vPnC - 7vPnC) > -10%.

group.title: 13vPnC Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix hexa at the 2- and 4-month visits. Adverse events were collected from dose 1 to approximately one month after dose 3.

group.title: 7vPnC Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix hexa at the 2- and 4-month visits. Adverse events were collected from dose 1 to approximately one month after dose 3.

group.title: 13vPnC Post-Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at the 6-month visit. Adverse events were collected from approximately one month after dose 3 to toddler dose.

group.title: 7vPnC Post-Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at the 6-month visit. Adverse events were collected from approximately one month after dose 3 to toddler dose.

group.title: 13vPnC Toddler Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix-IPV+Hib at the 15-month visit. Adverse events were collected for approximately one month after toddler dose.

group.title: 7vPnC Toddler Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with with NeisVac-C and Infanrix-IPV+Hib at the 15-month visit. Adverse events were collected for approximately one month after toddler dose.

group.title: 13vPnC 6-Month Follow-up
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix hexa at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series Dose 2) and one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at the 6-month visit (infant series dose 3). Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 13vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix IPV + Hib at the 15-month visit (toddler dose). MMR was administered without study vaccine at the 12-month visit. Adverse events were collected for approximately six months after last visit

group.title: 7vPnC 6-Month Follow-up
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix hexa at the 2- and 4-month visits (infant series Dose 2) and one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with Infanrix hexa at the 6-month visit (infant series dose 3). Participants received one single 0.5 mL dose of 7vPnC coadministered with NeisVac-C and Infanrix IPV + Hib at the 15-month visit (toddler dose). MMR was administered without study vaccine at the 12-month visit. Adverse events were collected for approximately six months after last visit

event.description: Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Fever ≥38°C but ≤39°C
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Fever >39°C but ≤40°C
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Fever >40°C
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Decreased appetite
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Irritability
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Increased sleep
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Decreased sleep

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.description: Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Tenderness (any)=present at site of vaccination.
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Tenderness (significant)=present and interfered with limb movement.
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose;Induration (any)=present at site of vaccination.
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Induration (mild)=0.5 centimeters (cm) to 2.0 cm.
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Induration (moderate)=2.5 cm to 7.0 cm.
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Induration (severe) >7.0 cm.
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Erythema (any)=present at site of vaccination.
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Erythema (mild)=0.5 centimeters (cm) to 2.0 cm.
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Erythema (moderate)=2.5 cm to 7.0 cm.
Infant Series Dose 1 and Toddler Dose; Erythema (severe) >7.0 cm.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The PIs agreed to allow the sponsor 60 days to review and require changes to presentations or publications but only to protect confidential information and intellectual property, and for the sponsor to file a patent application, as applicable. The PIs also agreed for data to be presented first as a joint, multi-center publication.
